thread.title: Woman found seriously injured in Manchester's Arndale Centre
thread.title_full: Woman found seriously injured in Manchester's Arndale Centre

author: Sam Yarwood
title: Woman found seriously injured in Manchester's Arndale Centre
text:
News Woman found seriously injured in Manchester's Arndale Centre The area around Topshop was shut off to customers on Friday morning as emergency services attended to the woman, who was bleeding heavily Share Manchester Arndale centre (Photo: Mark Waugh) Share Get   
A woman is in hospital after being found with serious injuries in Manchester’s Arndale Centre . 
The area around Topshop was shut off to customers on Friday morning as emergency services attended the scene. 
It is understood the casualty, in her 30s, had suffered cuts to her wrists and was bleeding heavily. 
Police and ambulance were called to the shopping centre at around 8.45am and the woman was taken to North Manchester General Hospital. 
A spokesman for GMP said: “We were called to a shop on Market Street at 8.45am to concerns for a women’s health. 
“We discovered a woman bleeding heavily from her wrists and she was handed into the care of the ambulance service.” Read More Man arrested following huge fire at church 
NWAS added: “We sent a rapid response vehicle and an ambulance to the scene and a woman in her 30s was conveyed to North Manchester General Hospital.” 
David Allinson, Centre Director for Manchester Arndale said: "We can confirm ambulance services attended the centre this morning. The safety of all involved and our shoppers and staff remains our first priority.” 
Both the Arndale Centre and police received tweets from concerned shoppers who had witnessed the incident. 
Tommy Jack posted: “@GMPCityCentre any update on what happened this morning in the Arndale? Is she at least ok?” 
Lydia Titterington wrote: “@manarndale what’s happened in @Topman.... no one is allowed to walk past the store.” 
The Arndale replied: “Our team dealt with an incident in that area early this morning, and the area has now been reopened for shoppers.” Like us on Facebook
